result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date 1-6-23 at 10:00 AM

2:42 PM Defendant Edward Russell Heaton in court.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for Edward Russell Heaton.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.
Arraignment scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:27 PM Defendant Edward Russell Heaton not in court.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for Edward Russell Heaton.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was unable to get a ride for today. The state requested warrant with a stay, Court authorized warrant with a stay until 11/2/22 at 2:00 PM. 2:31 PM

Bond goes into effect once residential treatment bed is found.  Defendant must notify Br 1 and Br 2 if treatment is completed or if expelled.

ADA Jonathan Ross appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person in custody with Atty Gibson Hatch. Motion for signature bond by Atty Hatch.  ADA Ross objected.  Court ordered $1000 signature bond once residential treatment bed is found.  Condition:  Atty Hatch or defendant must notify both Br 1 and Br 2 if defendant completes treatment or is expelled from facility.
